_comment: Agentic Readiness Test Suite Configuration - EDIT THIS FILE TO MODIFY TESTS
_instructions: To add a new test: Add an object to the 'tests' array with id, name, category, description, prompt, expectedTool/expectToolAny/expectedNoTool, and evaluationLogic
To modify test logic: Update the 'evaluationLogic' field to reference the corresponding evaluation function name
To change scoring: Modify the 'categoryWeights' and 'threshold' values
To disable a test: Remove it from the 'tests' array or add '_disabled': true
QUALIFYING GATE: First 5 tests (QG-1 to QG-5) are hard requirements - model is disqualified if ANY fail

Available evaluation functions: evaluateBasicToolEmit, evaluateMultiToolSelection, evaluateToolSuppression, evaluateArgumentValidation, evaluateNearIdenticalToolChoice, evaluateRAGFirstBehavior, evaluateRAGBeforeFileRead, evaluateRAGResultSynthesis, evaluateRAGChaining, evaluateMultiStepPlanning, evaluateConditionalLogic, evaluateContextContinuity, evaluateEdgeCaseAwareness, evaluateQuestionVsAction, evaluateImplicitFileRead, evaluateSearchIntentDetection, evaluateWebSearch, evaluatePageNavigation, evaluateContentExtraction, evaluateBrowserInteraction, evaluateToolFormatValid, evaluateInstructionFollowing, evaluateContextCoherence, evaluateBasicReasoning, evaluateStateTransition
description: Agentic Readiness Test Suite with Qualifying Gate - Tests for assessing agentic coding capabilities

tests._comment: === QUALIFYING GATE (QG-1 to QG-5) - MUST ALL PASS ===
tests.name: Tool Format Valid
tests.description: Model MUST output valid tool call format (JSON structure with function name and arguments)
tests.prompt: Read the file node-api/src/index.ts

tests.name: Instruction Following
tests.description: Model MUST follow system prompt structure and use provided tools
tests.prompt: List all files in the node-api/src directory.

tests.name: Context Coherence
tests.description: Model MUST NOT hallucinate files or context that doesn't exist
tests.prompt: What files are in the project root? Only list what you can verify.

tests.name: Basic Reasoning
tests.description: Model MUST break down multi-step tasks logically
tests.prompt: To add a new API endpoint, what files would I need to modify? Think step by step.

tests.name: State Transition
tests.description: Model MUST use tool results correctly (not ignore or contradict them)
tests.prompt: Read node-api/package.json and tell me the project name from that file.

tests.name: Basic Tool Emit
tests.description: Model should call read_file correctly
tests.prompt: Read the file react-web/src/App.tsx and tell me what it does.

tests.name: Multi-Tool Selection
tests.description: Model should choose the right tool among similar options
tests.prompt: Search for all TypeScript files that contain the word "authentication".

tests.name: Tool Suppression
tests.description: Model should NOT call a tool for a simple conversational query
tests.prompt: What is TypeScript?

tests.name: Argument Validation
tests.description: Model should provide correct and complete arguments to tools
tests.prompt: Write "Hello World" to a new file called hello.txt in the shared-utils folder.

tests.name: Near-Identical Tool Choice
tests.description: Model should choose read_file over read_multiple_files for a single file
tests.prompt: Show me the contents of node-api/package.json

tests.name: RAG-First Behavior
tests.description: Model should use rag_query first when exploring unfamiliar code
tests.prompt: How does the authentication system work in this codebase?

tests.name: RAG Before File Read
tests.description: Model should query RAG before blindly reading files
tests.prompt: Find where user passwords are validated.

tests.name: RAG Result Synthesis
tests.description: Model should synthesize RAG results into coherent answer
tests.prompt: What are the main components of this application?

tests.name: RAG Chaining
tests.description: Model should follow up RAG query with targeted file reads
tests.prompt: Show me the database connection code and explain how it connects.

tests.name: Multi-Step Planning
tests.description: Model should plan multiple steps for complex tasks
tests.prompt: Refactor the auth.service.ts to use dependency injection. First understand the current implementation, then propose changes.

tests.name: Conditional Logic
tests.description: Model should handle conditional requirements
tests.prompt: If the project uses TypeScript, add types to the validation.ts file. Otherwise, add JSDoc comments.

tests.name: Context Continuity
tests.description: Model should reference previously gathered information
tests.prompt: Based on the code structure, suggest where error handling should be improved.

tests.name: Edge Case Awareness
tests.description: Model should consider edge cases in its analysis
tests.prompt: Review the input validation in the API endpoints. Are there any missing edge cases?

tests.name: Question vs Action
tests.description: Model should answer questions without unnecessary tool calls
tests.prompt: Explain what dependency injection is and why it's useful.

tests.name: Implicit File Read
tests.description: Model should recognize implicit need to read files
tests.prompt: Fix any typos in the README file.

tests.name: Search Intent Detection
tests.description: Model should recognize when search is needed
tests.prompt: Find all TODO comments in the codebase.

tests.name: Web Search
tests.description: Model should use web_search for current information
tests.prompt: What is the latest version of React and what are its new features?

tests.name: Page Navigation
tests.description: Model should navigate to URLs when asked
tests.prompt: Go to https://docs.python.org and find the section on async programming.

tests.name: Content Extraction
tests.description: Model should extract content from web pages
tests.prompt: Get the main content from https://news.ycombinator.com and summarize the top stories.

tests.name: Browser Interaction
tests.description: Model should interact with browser elements
tests.prompt: Navigate to example.com and click the "More information" link.

tests.name: File Not Found Recovery
tests.description: Model should handle file not found errors gracefully and try alternatives
tests.prompt: Read the file nonexistent-file-12345.ts and summarize it. If it doesn't exist, search for similar files.

tests.name: Tool Failure Recovery
tests.description: Model should suggest alternatives when a tool fails
tests.prompt: Try to run the broken_tool_xyz command. If it fails, explain what you would do instead.

tests.name: Graceful Degradation
tests.description: Model should provide partial results when full completion isn't possible
tests.prompt: Analyze all 1000 test files in the tests/ folder. If that's too many, sample a representative set.

tests.name: Context Retention
tests.description: Model remembers context from previous turns in conversation
tests.prompt: Based on the file you just read, what port does the server listen on?

tests.name: Tool Chain Length 2

tests.name: Decision Nesting

tests.prompt: If the project has TypeScript config, check if it uses strict mode. If strict mode is enabled, find all files with 'any' type and list them. If not in strict mode, just count how many TypeScript files exist.
